docker.description: docker is a tool designed to make it easier to create, deploy, and run applications by using containers. Containers allow a developer to package up an application with all of the parts it needs, such as libraries and other dependencies, and ship it all out as one package.

docker --version.description: Display the version of Docker that is installed on the system.

docker run hello-world.description: This command is used to verify that Docker is installed correctly and that you can run containers.

docker images.description: This command is used to list all of the images that are stored on the system.

docker ps.description: This command is used to list all of the containers that are currently running on the system.

docker ps -a.description: This command is used to list all of the containers that are currently running on the system, including those that are stopped.

docker run <image-name>.description: This command is used to run a container from an image.

docker rmi <image-name>.description: This command is used to remove an image from the system.

docker rm <container-id>.description: This command is used to remove a container of id `container-id` from the system.

docker stop <container-id>.description: This command is used to stop a container of id `container-id`.

docker start <container-id>.description: This command is used to start a container of id `container-id`.

docker exec -it <container-id> /bin/bash.description: This command is used to open a shell inside a running container of id `container-id`.

docker build -t <image-name> ..description: This command is used to build an image from a Dockerfile. The -t flag is used to tag the image with a name.

docker push <image-name>.description: This command is used to push an image to a registry such as Docker Hub.

docker pull <image-name>.description: This command is used to pull an image from a registry such as Docker Hub.

docker tag <image-name> <new-image-name>.description: This command is used to tag an image with a new name.

docker login.description: This command is used to log in to a Docker registry such as Docker Hub.

docker logout.description: This command is used to log out of a Docker registry such as Docker Hub.

docker network ls.description: This command is used to list all of the networks that are available on the system.

docker network inspect <network-name>.description: This command is used to inspect a network of name `network-name`.
